text: Frank Giroud (May 3, 1956 – July 13, 2018) was a French comics writer. He was born in Toulouse, France. Giroud was a comics writer. He wrote the text for Louis la Guigne, drawn by Jean-Paul Dethorey. He also wrote the text for Mandrill, drawn by Barly Baruti, as well as Oubliés d’Annam and Azrayen, drawn by Christian Lax. In 2000, he created Le Décalogue, published by Glénat Editions. Giroud died on July 13, 2018 in Paris at the age of 62. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Writers from Toulouse
title: Frank Giroud
